newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines markets closed three days next week.
newsitem.headline: Philippines markets closed three days next week.

text.p: Philippine markets will be shut for three days next week beginning December 30 for a national holiday, the presidential palace said on Thursday.
Filipinos commemorate the death anniversary of national hero Jose Rizal on December 30 and celebrate New Year's Day on January 1.
The palace said December 31 has been declared a special non-working holiday under an executive order signed in 1987.
All financial markets, including the stock, money and foreign exchange markets, will be closed during the period and reopen on January 2. Friday will be the last trading day of the year.
